snippet.textDisplay: “21 Years” is a song I wrote about the recent passing of my firstborn son, Truett Foster McKeehan. I loved him with all my heart. Until something in life hits you this hard, you never know how you will handle it. I am thankful that I have been surrounded by love, starting with God’s and extending to community near and far that have walked with us and carried us every day. Writing this song felt like an honest confession of the questions, pain, anger, doubt, mercy and promise that describes the journey I’m probably only beginning. The rest is yet to come. One thing I know is that I am not alone. God didn’t promise us a life of no pain or even tragic death, but He did promise He would never leave us or forsake us. And I’m holding dearly to that promise for my son as well as myself.
snippet.textOriginal: “21 Years” is a song I wrote about the recent passing of my firstborn son, Truett Foster McKeehan. I loved him with all my heart. Until something in life hits you this hard, you never know how you will handle it. I am thankful that I have been surrounded by love, starting with God’s and extending to community near and far that have walked with us and carried us every day. Writing this song felt like an honest confession of the questions, pain, anger, doubt, mercy and promise that describes the journey I’m probably only beginning. The rest is yet to come. One thing I know is that I am not alone. God didn’t promise us a life of no pain or even tragic death, but He did promise He would never leave us or forsake us. And I’m holding dearly to that promise for my son as well as myself.

snippet.textDisplay: TobyMac, I lost my twin sister in July. We were both sixteen. I miss her so much. Thank you for sharing these beautiful words. They touch my heart so deeply. Praying for your family. I'm sure the pain is so deep but praise God that your son and my sister are in the beauty that is heaven.

snippet.textDisplay:
You're not alone, I'm crying with you Toby.

Therefore we do not lose heart, but though our outer man is decaying, yet our inner man is being renewed day by day. For momentary, light affliction is producing for us an eternal weight of glory far beyond all comparison, while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen; for the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal.

2 Corinthians 4:16‭-‬18 NASB
https://bible.com/bible/100/2co.4.16-18.NASB

I've lost my younger sister to an early death, my house and my savings after taking a stand for GOD at work which cost me my job, which separated me from my wife and only daughter. But all this heartache and pain can't even compare to the eternal JOY of being in the presence of GOD. NO comparison, none. Not apples and oranges, for those are both fruit. Temporary seen pain, no matter how intense can NOT compare to the JOY that awaits GOD'S people. Stand firm. Lift up your eyes, your redemption draws near. Don't lose heart. He will make all things new.

Peace & love from OKC.

snippet.textDisplay: My brother sometimes in life, we honestly just don't understand why God allows tragedy. Even though, we all know that we may die some day. Still, it shocks us and as the Bible says, "Death is a terrible sting." Yet, we are only human and losing a love one, sets us on a rollercoaster of emotions. With every hill, dip, twist, and turn cry out to God with all your heart and with all your might. For He knows and He cares.
snippet.textOriginal: My brother sometimes in life, we honestly just don't understand why God allows tragedy. Even though, we all know that we may die some day. Still, it shocks us and as the Bible says, "Death is a terrible sting." Yet, we are only human and losing a love one, sets us on a rollercoaster of emotions. With every hill, dip, twist, and turn cry out to God with all your heart and with all your might. For He knows and He cares.

snippet.textDisplay: This is has to be the best song I've heard in years. I love that you are real in it about how you felt and are feeling. Thank you. While I do not understand what you went through. I can say it touches my heart and is the first song in a long time I've shed tears in a song (with and for you and your son). It also makes me think about how grateful I have my son who is 5 and the relationship I fight daily to build with him. Especially since I grew up without a father and want him to know the true measure of a man through God and Christ. This song will touch many in so many different ways and I know that is the simple true. ❤
snippet.textOriginal: This is has to be the best song I've heard in years. I love that you are real in it about how you felt and are feeling. Thank you. While I do not understand what you went through. I can say it touches my heart and is the first song in a long time I've shed tears in a song (with and for you and your son). It also makes me think about how grateful I have my son who is 5 and the relationship I fight daily to build with him. Especially since I grew up without a father and want him to know the true measure of a man through God and Christ. This song will touch many in so many different ways and I know that is the simple true. ❤

snippet.textDisplay: Dear Toby.... I know you are getting 1000's of replies here and you may never read this but let me publicly say how God has used this tragedy to touch the hearts of so many.  My wife and I listened to this song this morning and were both brought to tears as you shared your true heart... a heart for Christ that totally is dependent on Him.  Thank you for being a light for Jesus through this.  We have prayed for you and your family.  I look forward to meeting Truett in heaven someday.

Thank you for being a light for Jesus through this.  We have prayed for you and your family.  I look forward to meeting Truett in heaven someday.

snippet.textDisplay:
When you lose your parents, you're called an orphan.


But when you lose your children, there's no word for that, because words can't describe the pain
snippet.textOriginal:
When you lose your parents, you're called an orphan.


But when you lose your children, there's no word for that, because *words can't describe the pain*

snippet.textDisplay: Losing a child has to be the most difficult thing for a person to go through. My heart goes out to TobyMac and anyone else who’s going through this.
snippet.textOriginal: Losing a child has to be the most difficult thing for a person to go through. My heart goes out to TobyMac and anyone else who’s going through this.

snippet.textDisplay: Toby I understand your pain so clearly.  My son was brutally murdered in October 2019. He was 20 years old. The day the coroner came to my door and I seen the words of her mouth say he was killed, I realized I had two choices in the split second of that silence, to walk away from my faith or trust His sovereignty and will.  I went to my prayer room and I lifted my hands to heaven and my eyes to the hills from where my help comes from and recited Job, God giveth and God Taketh BLESSED BE THE NAME OF THE LORD. I decided to stand on the scripture that declares NOTHING and not even the murder and death of my son will separate him nor me from the love of God through our Lord Jesus Christ. I am praying you will read this and be encouraged as we mourn together and wait upon the Lord.  Everyone will tell us to be strong but the strongest thing we can do is surrender all our pain to Him for He cares for us like no other!! I pray I could share more of my sons life with you so that you can see Gods thumbprint upon your precious baby boys life too. God bless you man of God!!
snippet.textOriginal: Toby I understand your pain so clearly.  My son was brutally murdered in October 2019. He was 20 years old. The day the coroner came to my door and I seen the words of her mouth say he was killed, I realized I had two choices in the split second of that silence, to walk away from my faith or trust His sovereignty and will.  I went to my prayer room and I lifted my hands to heaven and my eyes to the hills from where my help comes from and recited Job, God giveth and God Taketh BLESSED BE THE NAME OF THE LORD. I decided to stand on the scripture that declares NOTHING and not even the murder and death of my son will separate him nor me from the love of God through our Lord Jesus Christ. I am praying you will read this and be encouraged as we mourn together and wait upon the Lord.  Everyone will tell us to be strong but the strongest thing we can do is surrender all our pain to Him for He cares for us like no other!! I pray I could share more of my sons life with you so that you can see Gods thumbprint upon your precious baby boys life too. God bless you man of God!!

snippet.textDisplay: Con mucho dolor escribio esto pero nos identificamos con ustedes pero servirle a Dios cuesta un ejemplo a seguir es la vida de Job que por Amar a Dios genuinamente lo perdio todo mi esposo y yoservimos a Dios en la iglesia por 29 años y por causa de una enfermedad mi esposo tuvo que parar pero seguimos en El Camino de Dios tenemos dis hijos batallando en sus vidas uno tratando de estar sobrio y otro que tuvo una sobredosis el año pasado y Dios lo salvo pero sigue batallando con las drogas no dejamos de orar por ellos ni un momento .Igual que ustedes amamos a Dios en Todo tiempo en tormentas y en calma.Y recuerden un dia ban a mirar a su hijo nuevamene .Dios es fiel y merece today la Gloria y la honrra.

snippet.textDisplay:
“You give and give away
You give and take away.
But my heart still choose to say
Lord, blessed be Your Name”

~Blessed Be Your Name

I feel that this fits perfectly well with this song, especially with the faith that Toby and his family has.

snippet.textDisplay: Heartbreaking! As a Mom I can almost imagine the heartbreak of losing a child. My now 21 year old son attempted suicide nearly four years ago, and we almost lost him. I remember vividly being prompted to pray for him just hours before he cut his arm open, and I wept as I prayed God would save his life. I remember that grief, pain and heartache as if it were yesterday, and I would never wish the loss of a child on any parent. Prayers for the family of this young man, that God will hold them in His arms and bring them peace and comfort in their time of mourning.
snippet.textOriginal: Heartbreaking! As a Mom I can almost imagine the heartbreak of losing a child. My now 21 year old son attempted suicide nearly four years ago, and we almost lost him. I remember vividly being prompted to pray for him just hours before he cut his arm open, and I wept as I prayed God would save his life. I remember that grief, pain and heartache as if it were yesterday, and I would never wish the loss of a child on any parent. Prayers for the family of this young man, that God will hold them in His arms and bring them peace and comfort in their time of mourning.

snippet.textDisplay: I was 21 when I lost my oldest son tragically. He was only 2....a baby losing a baby. My prayer was always to have a heart that says the Lord gives and the Lord takes. Blessed be the name of the Lord.(My heart isn't always in that place. It is real work of God to rest there) I didn't pray to understand why because i didn't know if it were possible to understand God's ways. But He showed me over time that He brought my son home to protect him. Fast forward...it has been 22 years since and am a crying mess listening to this song. I don't forget those first seconds, minutes, hours and days...the pain...waking up to the nightmare all over again everyday. But Abba's mercies are new every morning. I love Him for that. The mercy that not only holds my son but also me.
snippet.textOriginal: I was 21 when I lost my oldest son tragically. He was only 2....a baby losing a baby. My prayer was always to have a heart that says the Lord gives and the Lord takes. Blessed be the name of the Lord.(My heart isn't always in that place. It is real work of God to rest there) I didn't pray to understand why because i didn't know if it were possible to understand God's ways. But He showed me over time that He brought my son home to protect him. Fast forward...it has been 22 years since and am a crying mess listening to this song. I don't forget those first seconds, minutes, hours and days...the pain...waking up to the nightmare all over again everyday. But Abba's mercies are new every morning. I love Him for that.
